com.facebook.buck.cli

Class BuckConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.cli.BuckConfig

  • @Beta
@Immutable
public class BuckConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Structured representation of data read from a .buckconfig file.

      • getMaybeBuildTarget

        public Optional<BuildTarget> getMaybeBuildTarget(java.lang.String section,
                                        java.lang.String field)
        Returns:
        the parsed BuildTarget in the given section and field, if set and a valid build target. This is useful if you use getTool to get the target, if any, but allow filesystem references.

      • getBasePathToAliasMap

        public ImmutableMap<java.nio.file.Path,java.lang.String> getBasePathToAliasMap()
        Create a map of BuildTarget base paths to aliases. Note that there may be more than one alias to a base path, so the first one listed in the .buckconfig will be chosen.

      • getTestTempDirEnvVars

        public Optional<ImmutableList<java.lang.String>> getTestTempDirEnvVars()
        By default, running tests use a temporary directory under buck-out. Since this directory is ignored by Watchman and other tools, allow overriding this behavior for projects that need it by specifying one or more environment variables which are checked for a temporary directory to use.

      • createAnsi

        public Ansi createAnsi(Optional<java.lang.String> defaultColor)
        Create an Ansi object appropriate for the current output. First respect the user's preferences, if set. Next, respect any default provided by the caller. (This is used by buckd to tell the daemon about the client's terminal.) Finally, allow the Ansi class to autodetect whether the current output is a tty.
        Parameters:
        defaultColor - Default value provided by the caller (e.g. the client of buckd)

      • getSkipLocalBuildChainDepth

        public Optional<java.lang.Long> getSkipLocalBuildChainDepth()
        Returns:
        the depth of a local build chain which should trigger skipping the cache.
